Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in assessing work experience and procedural fairness
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR) Section 112
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Handwritten documents, tax statements, discrepancies in format and signatures
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of work permit application upheld
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove required caregiving experience
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Documents deemed unreliable due to inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Applicant must prove six months of classroom training or one year of full-time live-in caregiver experience under IRPR s. 112
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged breach of procedural fairness during interview
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness of decision based on evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach found; no evidence of bias
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Employment records, tax documents, application forms
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged credibility assessment and alleged unfair treatment
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Officer maintained refusal due to document unreliability
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant for work permit as live-in caregiver
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Work permit application under live-in caregiver category

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant failed to demonstrate required experience with authentic documents
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR) Section 112
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Documents lacked consistency and authenticity; deemed not credible
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet documentary requirements for caregiver work permit
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in document formats, signatures, and prior declarations
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative immigration proceeding with judicial review
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Authenticity and reliability of submitted documents
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None; officer reviewed all documents but found them unconvincing
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Requirement to prove one year of full-time caregiver experience or six months of training
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of refusal based on evidentiary concerns
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Questionable authenticity of documents and lack of credible evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancies in formatting, missing official seals, inconsistent signatures
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged fabrication or falsification of employment records
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant's documentation lacked corroboration and showed internal inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant claimed documents were genuine but failed to substantiate
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of fair opportunity to respond
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide verifiable, consistent documentation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation or failure to meet eligibility criteria

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer reasonably concluded lack of qualifying experience and authenticity issues
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Submitted documents considered unreliable due to discrepancies
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Employment records, tax documents, application materials
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet experience requirement for live-in caregiver
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness of officer’s interpretation and findings
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible, consistent evidence supporting work experience
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative immigration decision subject to judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Insufficient proof of required caregiver experience
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Authenticity and sufficiency of supporting documentation
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None explicitly ignored; officer assessed and rejected credibility
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Proof of one year full-time caregiver work or six months training
Crimes.Application_Factor: Reliability and consistency of submitted evidence
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Was the refusal reasonable and procedurally fair?
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of required experience and questionable document authenticity
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in document formats, signatures, and declarations
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach of procedural fairness found
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Suspicion of fabricated or altered employment records
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant’s evidence lacked third-party verification and showed anomalies
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant contested reliability of officer’s assessment
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to submit reliable, verifiable documentation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Failure to meet program requirements / potential misrepresentation
